snippet: Crown Prince Maha Vajiralongkorn’s lavish European lifestyle and tastes for airplanes, fast cars, women and the high life have caused anxiety....
abstract: Thailand, grieving over death of beloved King Bhumibol Adulyadej, is faced with succession many Thais say they wish they could avoid; his son Crown Prince Vajrialongkom is heir to throne, but doubts arise as to whether he could keep country, torn by deep class and political divisions, together; prince has led jet-setting life seemingly devoid of deep devotion to public that was hallmark of his father's tenure.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and THOMAS FULLER
byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Tutzing, Germany, and Thomas Fuller from San Francisco. Victor Homola contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Crown Prince Maha Vajiralongkorn’s lavish European lifestyle and tastes for airplanes, fast cars, women and the high life have caused anxiety.

headline.main: Thailand Looks to Likely Future King With Apprehension
headline.print_headline: Grieving Thailand Looks Warily to Royal Heir
